doc.previous: Tree species succession may change tree species composition once the old growth stage has been achieved For example an old boreal forest may contain some large aspen trees which may die and be replaced by smaller balsam fir or black spruce Consequently the forest will switch back to Understory Reinitiation stage 12 If old growth stage is seen as an end point of stand development it can be easily evaluated using structural or static attributes However in some forest ecosystems this can lead to decisions regarding the preservation of unique stands or attributes that will disappear over the next few decades because of natural succession processes Consequently using stand dynamics to define old growth forest is more useful in cases where the species that constitute old growth forest can have long life span or in ecosystem where succession is very slow
doc.after: Common cultural definitions and common denominators regarding what comprises old growth forest and of the variables that define constitute and embody old growth forests include
